We are committed to delivering first class innovation, quality, and state of the art technology solutions to discerning clients both in the private and public sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Software Tester

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a Software Tester who is passionate about product quality and eager to ensure a seamless experience for our users.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in manual and automated testing and will contribute to every stage of the QA process.
	Experience or interest in Security Testing, particularly VAPT, is a strong advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and execute detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts for web and mobile platforms.
	Perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.
	Identify, report, and manage bugs and inconsistencies using tracking tools like JIRA or Azure DevOps.
	Work closely with developers, product managers, and UI/UX designers to improve product quality.
	Collaborate in agile sprints and participate in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
	Support test automation and contribute to improving the QA process and test coverage.
	Assist in basic security testing and vulnerability checksas part of the release cycle.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a software testing or QA role.
	Strong understanding of QA methodologies, SDLC, and testing best practices.
	Familiarity with automated testing tools (e.g., Selenium, Postman, JMeter).
	Experience testing web applications and APIs.
	Knowledge of test management tools and bug tracking systems.
	Good communication skills and strong attention to detail.
	Bonus: Familiarity withVAPT, OWASP Top 10, or basic cybersecurity testing principles.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation and performance bonuses.
	A chance to work on a high-impact SaaS product.
	Opportunities for career growth, learning, and certifications.
	Flexible work arrangements (remote/hybrid).
	A collaborative, innovative, and mission-driven culture.

Quality Assurance Software Tester Job at Snapnet Limited




        
    

        
        Snapnet, a leading technology consulting firm and certified partner of Microsoft, AWS, Oracle, Huawei, and other global OEMs. Snapnet is an ICT Consulting firm with strategic focus in developing Industry specific solutions, Business consulting and Systems Integration with offices in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria. We are committed to delivering first class innovation, quality, and state of the art technology solutions to discerning clients both in the private and public sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Software Tester

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a Software Tester who is passionate about product quality and eager to ensure a seamless experience for our users.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in manual and automated testing and will contribute to every stage of the QA process.
	Experience or interest in Security Testing, particularly VAPT, is a strong advantage.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and execute detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts for web and mobile platforms.
	Perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing.
	Identify, report, and manage bugs and inconsistencies using tracking tools like JIRA or Azure DevOps.
	Work closely with developers, product managers, and UI/UX designers to improve product quality.
	Collaborate in agile sprints and participate in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.
	Support test automation and contribute to improving the QA process and test coverage.
	Assist in basic security testing and vulnerability checksas part of the release cycle.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a software testing or QA role.
	Strong understanding of QA methodologies, SDLC, and testing best practices.
	Familiarity with automated testing tools (e.g., Selenium, Postman, JMeter).
	Experience testing web applications and APIs.
	Knowledge of test management tools and bug tracking systems.
	Good communication skills and strong attention to detail.
	Bonus: Familiarity withVAPT, OWASP Top 10, or basic cybersecurity testing principles.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation and performance bonuses.
	A chance to work on a high-impact SaaS product.
	Opportunities for career growth, learning, and certifications.
	Flexible work arrangements (remote/hybrid).
	A collaborative, innovative, and mission-driven culture.

We manufacture different drugs for improve livestock’s health. Our product is specially tailored to suit the environmental sustainability of livestock’s within Nigeria. Our animal health products undergo rigorous quality control to be certified fit for use on farm animals. Proudly Nigerian: All round availability; Very few produces in Nigeria; majority imports; Guaranteed Quality that matches imported brands: Active Pharmaceutical; Ingredient is source from the best in Europe and Asia and Competitive Pricing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

	The role combines direct selling with proactive customer engagement to retain and grow the customer base.

	Actively promote and sell the company’s products and solutions to existing and prospective customers in the region.
	Build and manage strong relationships with customers, distributors, and key accounts.
	Monitor customer buying patterns and provide insights to improve sales strategy and service delivery.
	Work with the logistics and supply chain team to ensure timely delivery and resolve delivery challenges.

	Conduct field visits, customer check-ins, and service follow-ups to ensure satisfaction and repeat business.
	Respond promptly to customer inquiries, complaints, and service issues, ensuring resolution within defined timelines.
	Educate customers on product usage, features, and value propositions.
	Track sales targets and performance metrics; submit weekly and monthly reports.
	Represent the company at trade shows, customer forums, and regional product activations.
	Promote brand loyalty through customer engagement programs and feedback collection.

	Monthly sales targets achieved
	Customer retention rate
	Customer satisfaction feedback scores
	Resolution time for complaints
	Market coverage and new accounts opened


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Marketing, Business Administration, Agricultural Science, or related discipline.
	Minimum 2–3 years of experience in sales, account management, or customer-facing roles.
	Experience in the agro-allied, FMCG, or pharmaceutical sector is a plus.
	Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and persuasive communication skills.
	Ability to travel extensively within the South West.
	Proficient in MS Office; CRM or sales reporting tools is an added advantage.


Core Competencies:


	Customer-centric mindset
	Strong sales and negotiation ability
	Self-motivated with fieldwork discipline
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution
	Team collaboration and communication
